Home / Tree Recommendation / Tamarind

Tamarind

Scientific Name Tamarindus indica – L.
Family Fabaceae

  : Tender. Minimum temperature 10° C (50° F) Requires heated glass

  :  Well Drained Soil

  :  Moist Soil

  :  Full Sun

Back
Category: Tree Recommendation
  • Growing Guide
  • Key Characteristics

Description

  • This is an evergreen Tree growing to 20 m (65ft) by 20 m (65ft) at a slow rate.
  • The flowers are pollinated by Insects.
  • It can fix Nitrogen.
  • Suitable for: light (sandy), medium (loamy) and heavy (clay) soils and prefers well-drained soil.
  • Suitable pH: acid, neutral and basic (alkaline) soils and can grow in very acid and saline soils.
  • It cannot grow in the shade.
  • It prefers dry or moist soil and can tolerate drought.
  • The plant can tolerate maritime exposure.
  • Edible Parts: Flowers, Leaves, Seed, Seedpod.

Additional information

Moisture

Moist
Wind Resistance

Tolerates Maritime Exposure
Edibility

Medium
Medicinal Rating

Above average
